headline: A Weimar-Era Operetta Returns to Berlin
abstract: The Komische Oper has reconstructed Jaromir Weinberger’s “Frühlingsstürme,” a show that was virtually erased by Nazi rule in Germany.
lead_paragraph: BERLIN — It was an evening in late January 1933, not long before Hitler was sworn in as the German chancellor, when Jaromir Weinberger’s operetta “Frühlingsstürme” (“Spring Storms”) had its premiere.
